title: Windows NT 4.0
summary: Windows NT 4.0 is a major release of the Windows NT operating system developed by Microsoft and oriented towards businesses. It was the direct successor to Windows NT 3.51, and was released to manufacturing on July 31, 1996,[1] and was launched to retail on August 24, 1996, one year after the release of Windows 95, and two years before the release of Windows 98. Windows NT 4.0 was and remains a primary business-oriented operating system, and three years after its introduction, it was followed by Windows 2000. Workstation, server and embedded editions were sold, and all editions feature a graphical user interface similar to that of Windows 95.
